sen.j: 岩倉使節団（いわくらしせつだん）とは明治4年11月12日 (旧暦)（1871年12月23日）から明治6年（1873年）9月13日まで、日本からアメリカ合衆国、ヨーロッパ諸国に派遣された使節団である。
sen.e: Iwakura Mission was a delegation which was dispatched to the United States of America and European countries from Japan between December 23, 1871 and September 13, 1873.
Iwakura Mission was a delegation which was dispatched to the United States of America and European countries from Japan between December 23, 1871 and September 13, 1873.
Iwakura Mission was a delegation which was dispatched to the United States of America and European countries from Japan between December 23, 1871 and September 13, 1873.

sen.j: 岩倉具視を正使とし、政府のトップや留学生を含む総勢107名で構成された。
sen.e: It consisted of a total 107 people including the highest ranks of government and overseas students with Tomomi IWAKURA as seishi (senior envoy).
It consisted of a total 107 people including the highest ranks of government and students with Tomomi IWAKURA as seishi (senior envoy).
sen.cmt: overseas student では「海外からの留学生」の意になるので変えました。
sen.e: It consisted of a total 107 people including the highest ranks of government and students with Tomomi IWAKURA as seishi (senior envoy).

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）に横浜港を船で出発し、サンフランシスコに上陸。
sen.e: They left Yokohama Port by ship in 1871, landing on San Francisco.
They left Yokohama Port by ship in 1871, landing on San Francisco.
They left Yokohama Port by ship in 1871, landing on San Francisco.

sen.j: アメリカ大陸を横断しワシントンD.C.を訪問した後、ヨーロッパへ渡り各国を訪問した。
sen.e: They visited the European countries after crossing the continent of the United States of America and visiting Washington, D.C.
They visited the European countries after crossing the continent of the United States of America and visiting Washington, D.C.
They visited the European countries after crossing the continent of the United States of America and visiting Washington, D.C.

sen.j: ヨーロッパでの訪問国は、イギリス・フランス・ベルギー・オランダ・ドイツ・ロシア・デンマーク・スウェーデン・オーストリア・イタリア・スイスの12カ国に上る。
sen.e: They visited as many as 12 countries in Europe which were Britain,France,Belgium,the Netherlands,Germany,Russia,Denmark,Sweden,Austria,Italia and Switzerland.
They visited as many as 12 countries in Europe which were Britain, France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany, Russia, Denmark, Sweden, Austria, Italy and Switzerland.
sen.cmt: Italia を Italy に変え、コンマの後に半角スペースを入れました
sen.e: They visited as many as 12 countries in Europe which were Britain, France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany, Russia, Denmark, Sweden, Austria, Italy and Switzerland.

sen.j: 帰途はアジア各国への訪問も行われたがこれはヨーロッパでの滞在に比べれば短いものであった。
sen.e: They visited Asian countries on their way back,however,it was a short time compared with their visit in European countries.
They also visited Asian countries on their way back, however, they didn't stay in these countries longer than in European countries.
sen.cmt: it が何を指しているのか不明だったので一部変えました。
sen.e: They also visited Asian countries on their way back, however, they didn't stay in these countries longer than in European countries.

sen.j: 日本に帰国したのは出発から2年後の明治6年（1873年）である。
sen.e: They returned to Japan in 1873, 2 years after their departure.
They returned to Japan in 1873, 2 years after their departure.
They returned to Japan in 1873, 2 years after their departure.

sen.j: 留守政府では朝鮮出兵を巡る征韓論が争われ、使節の帰国後に明治6年の政変に至る。
sen.e: There was an argument over Japan's Invasion of Korea,Seikanron,in Rusu-seifu (government while heads of government are away),leading to political changes in 1873 after the delegation had returned.

While they were away, Japanese government without them called Rusu-seifu (government while heads of government are away) had a debate over Japan's dispatching of troops to Korea, Seikanron, which led to political changes in 1873 after the delegation returned.
sen.cmt: Rusu-seifu の意味が曖昧なので少し説明を加え、過去完了の時制が前後していたので変えました。
sen.e: While they were away, Japanese government without them called Rusu-seifu (government while heads of government are away) had a debate over Japan's dispatching of troops to Korea, Seikanron, which led to political changes in 1873 after the delegation returned.

sen.j: 元々大隈重信の発案による小規模な使節団を派遣する予定であったが、政治的思惑などから大規模なものとなる。
sen.e: Originally,a small delegation was to be dispatched,based on the idea of Shigenobu OKUMA, however, it was changed to be a big one due to political agendas.
Originally,a small delegation was to be dispatched,based on the idea of Shigenobu OKUMA, however, it was changed to be a big one due to political agendas.
Originally,a small delegation was to be dispatched,based on the idea of Shigenobu OKUMA, however, it was changed to be a big one due to political agendas.

sen.j: 政府のトップが長期間政府を離れ外遊するというのは異例であるが、直に西洋文明や思想に触れたという経験が彼らに与えた影響は評価される。
sen.e: It is appreciated the effect of the experience of feeling western civilization and thought directly on them,though it was unusual the highest ranks of government traveled abroad,leaving the government long time.

Although it was unusual that the highest ranks of government traveled abroad leaving the government for a long time, it is appreciated that they could directly experience Western civilization and thought which had great impact on them.
sen.cmt: though ではなく although を使うとのことだったので変えました。またit is ～ that節にしました。
sen.e: Although it was unusual for senior government members to leave the government and travel abroad for a long period of time, they are believed to have done so on the basis that it would enable them to directly experience Western civilization and thought, which had a great impact on them.

sen.j: 留学生も帰国後に政治、経済、教育、文化など様々な分野で活躍し、日本の文明開化に大きく貢献した。
sen.e: The overseas students helped greatly in civilization and enlightenment,serving in various fields such as politics,economics,education and culture.
The returned students contributed greatly to Japan's civilization and enlightenment serving in various fields such as politics, economics, education and culture.
sen.cmt: overseeas student では「海外からの留学生」となるので returned student に変えました。又、「貢献する」→contribute to にして、コンマの後は半角スペースを入れました。
sen.e: The returned students contributed greatly to Japan's civilization and enlightenment serving in various fields such as politics, economics, education and culture.

sen.j: しかし一方では権限を越えて条約改正交渉を行おうとしたことによる留守政府との摩擦、外遊期間の大幅な延期、木戸と大久保の不仲などの政治的な問題を引き起こし「条約は結び損い金は捨て 世間へ大使何と岩倉」と狂歌の題材にされた。
sen.e: On the other hand,they caused political problems such as conflict between Rusu-seifu (government while heads of government are away) due to their attempt to negotiate for treaty revision which was beyond their authority,long delay of their return and quarrel between Kido and Okubo,which became the subject of the kyoka (comic ［satirical］ tanka) saying'Failed in signing a treaty,threw out money, how can you explain to the world'

On the other hand, they caused political problems such as a conflict with Rusu-seifu due to their attempt to negotiate for treaty revision which was beyond their authority, long delay of their return from overseas and a quarrel between Kido and Okubo, which became the subject of the kyoka (comic ［satirical］ tanka) that went like this, 'Failed in signing a treaty, threw out money, how can you explain to the world.'
sen.cmt: conflict の後 between を withに変えました。
sen.e: On the other hand, they caused political problems such as a conflict with Rusu-seifu due to their attempt to negotiate for treaty revision which was beyond their authority, long delay of their return from overseas and a quarrel between Kido and Okubo, which became the subject of the kyoka (comic ［satirical］ tanka) that went like this, 'Failed in signing a treaty, threw out money, how can you explain to the world.'

sen.j: 使節団のほとんどは断髪・洋装であったが、岩倉は髷と和服という姿で渡洋した。
sen.e: Most of all members of the delegation had danpatsu (brobbed hair) and dressed in Western style,however,Iwakura had mage and dressed in wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes) when he crossed the sea.

Most members of the delegation had danpatsu (brobbed hair) and dressed in Western style, however, Iwakura wore the topknot and dressed in wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes) when he crossed the sea.
sen.cmt: 「髷」はmage よりも topknot にしたほうが分かりやすいと思い変えました。
sen.e: Most members of the delegation had danpatsu (brobbed hair) and dressed in Western style, however, Iwakura wore the topknot and dressed in wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes) when he crossed the sea.

sen.j: この姿はアメリカの新聞の挿絵にも残っている。
sen.e: There was an illustration of his such appearance in the newspaper of America.
There was an illustration of his such appearance in the newspaper of America.
There was an illustration of his such appearance in the newspaper of America.

sen.j: 日本の文化に対して誇りを持っていたためであったがアメリカに留学していた子の岩倉具定らに「未開の国と侮りを受ける」と説得され、シカゴで断髪。
sen.e: He did it because he was proud of Japanese culture,however,he cut his hair in Chicago,being persuaded that they would be insulted as uncivilized country by Tomosada IWAKURA and others who were overseas students.

He did it because he was proud of Japanese culture, however, he cut off the topknot in Chicago after his son Tomosada IWAKURA, who were studying in America, and others persuaded him that Japan would be insulted as an uncivilized country.
sen.cmt: 意味をとって、「断髪」を cut off the topknot に変えました。「息子の」が抜けていたので加えました。 as uncivilized country とあるので 「侮りをうける」の主語を Japan にしました。
sen.e: He did it because he was proud of Japanese culture, however, he cut off the topknot in Chicago after his son Tomosada IWAKURA, who were studying in America, and others persuaded him that Japan would be insulted as an uncivilized country.

sen.j: 後は洋装に改めた。
sen.e: He changed to western style after that.
He changed to western style after that.
He changed to western style after that.

sen.j: 条約を結んでいる各国を訪問し、元首に国書を提出する
sen.e: To visit the countries having a treaty with Japan,submitting official letters to heads of states.
To visit the countries that had a treaty with Japan, and submit the official letters to the heads of these countries.
sen.cmt: ing形が並び、分かりにくいのではと思い変えました。
sen.e: To visit the countries that had a treaty with Japan, and submit the official letters to the heads of these countries.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期に諸外国と結ばれた不平等条約の改正（条約改正）のための予備交渉
sen.e: To have preliminary negotiations to revise the unequal treaty (treaty revision) which had been signed between foreign countries and Japan in the late Edo period.
To have preliminary negotiations to revise the unequal treaty (treaty revision) which had been signed between foreign countries and Japan in the late Edo period.
To have preliminary negotiations to revise the unequal treaty (treaty revision) which had been signed between foreign countries and Japan in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 西洋文明の調査
使節46名、随員18名、留学生43名。
sen.e: It consisted of 46 envoys,18 accompanying personnels, 43 overseas students.
It consisted of 46 envoys,18 accompanying personnels, 43 overseas students.
It consisted of 46 envoys,18 accompanying personnels, 43 overseas students.

sen.j: 使節は薩長中心、書記官などは旧幕臣から選ばれた。
sen.e: Envoys were chosen among Saccho and secretaries among former retainer of shogun.
Envoys were chosen among people from Saccho (Satsuma Domain and Choshu Domain) and secretaries were among former retainer of shogun.
Envoys were chosen among people from Saccho (Satsuma Domain and Choshu Domain) and secretaries were among former retainer of shogun.

sen.j: 岩倉具視：特命全権大使
sen.cmt: 「特命全権大使」がローマ字だけではわかりにくいと思い、加えました。

sen.j: 木戸孝允（桂小五郎）：副使
sen.cmt: 大文字になっていたので変えました。

池田政懋：四等書記官
久米邦武：大使随行
中山信彬：大使随行
内海忠勝：大使随行
野村靖：大使随行
五辻安仲：大使随行
田中光顕：理事官
東久世通禧：理事官
山田顕義：理事官
佐佐木高行：理事官
田中不二麿：理事官
肥田浜五郎：理事官
村田新八：随行
原田一道：随行
中江兆民：イギリス留学

sen.e: Chomin NAKAE: student studying in England
